bug.description:
The following code does not run (where self.space=Hypersphere(4)): n_geodesic_points = 10 initial_point = self.space.random_uniform(2) vector = gs.array([[2., 0., -1., -2., 1.]] * 2) initial_tangent_vec = self.space.to_tangent( vector=vector, base_point=initial_point) geodesic = self.metric.geodesic( initial_point=initial_point, initial_tangent_vec=initial_tangent_vec)
t = gs.linspace(start=0., stop=1., num=n_geodesic_points) points = geodesic(t) In fact it won't be possible to fully vectorize the path method of geodesics, because it would require exp and log method to take input of shapes [n_times, n_samples, {dim [n,n]}], so there is an extra dimension we are not ready to deal with. We can either
update the doc to mention it's not vectorized call path separately for each sample with a for loop.
